intro: Dunbaria longicarpa, commonly known as the long-fruited dunbaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, and it produces elongated, cylindrical fruits. Dunbaria longicarpa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique fruit structure.
